content:
You approach a group of sailors gathered around a small wooden barrel, which serves as their makeshift table. They're engaged in a lively game of dice, with coins changing hands as the players cheer and groan in response to each roll.

One of the sailors, a burly man with a bushy beard, notices your interest and grins. "Ahoy, mate! Care to join us for a game? It's a simple wager – highest roll wins the pot. Just toss in a coin and give the dice a throw!"

The game is played with a d6, and the player with the highest roll takes the pot. You can decide how much you want to wager – a silver or a gold piece, perhaps – and roll the d6 to see if you can come out on top.

To make your roll, type /roll d6, and let me know how much you're wagering. I'll describe the outcome based on your roll and the rolls of the other players.
